subject: Science
title: Inside the Sun's Core
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Inside the Sun's Core.

hook.text: The Sun's surface is hot. Its core is 27 million degrees Fahrenheit.

buildup.text: Every second, 600 million tons of hydrogen fuse into helium deep inside.

discovery.text: That energy takes 170,000 years to travel from core to surface as light.

twist.text: A photon bounces billions of times through dense plasma before escaping.

climax.text: Once it leaves the surface, that same photon reaches Earth in just 8 minutes.

punchline.text: Sunlight on your face is 170,000 years old â€” plus 8 minutes.

quiz.question: How long does energy take to travel from the Sun's core to its surface?
